step_feedback.feedback: While the arm extension was mostly smooth, inconsistent fist clenching and wrist movements were observed. Focus on a tighter fist during the inhale and a more controlled exhale as you extend your arms.
The muscle tightening and relaxation were not fully synchronized with the breathing. Try to coordinate your inhale with the fist clenching and exhale with the arm extension more precisely.
The arm extension needs more control and smoothness.  Aim for a steady, controlled movement to shoulder height, avoiding jerky motions.
The exercise lacked consistent muscle engagement throughout.  Concentrate on maintaining muscle tension during the inhale and releasing it fully during the exhale.
The final repetitions showed significant inconsistencies and jerky movements.  Remember to maintain a slow, controlled pace throughout the exercise, focusing on proper form.

exercise_summary: You almost got the hang of horizontal pumping! Remember to clench your fists tightly when inhaling and extend your arms smoothly to shoulder height while exhaling.  Focus on coordinating your breathing with the arm movements for better results. Let's work on consistency in the next session.
